    • Method Detail

      • ezidUri

        public static URI ezidUri(org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI doi)
        This creates the EZID URI, and ensures that it is formatted correctly, e.g. E.g. http://ezid.cdlib.org/id/doi:10.nnnn/suffix Notice the DOI must start with the DOI access schema ("doi:").
        The EZID URI is used to manipulate the identifier and is used as the address in the HTTP request.
        Parameters:
        doi - identifier
        Returns:
        EZID URI

      • get

        public URI get(org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI doi)
        throws DoiException
        Description copied from interface: DoiService
        Resolves the registered identifier to its URL.
        Specified by:
        get in interface DoiService
        Parameters:
        doi - the identifier to get metadata for
        Returns:
        the URL the DOI is backed by or null if DOI does not exist or is only reserved
        Throws:
        DoiException - if the operation failed for any reason

      • reserve

        public void reserve(org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI doi,
           DataCiteMetadata metadata)
             throws DoiException
        Description copied from interface: DoiService
        Reserves a new identifier. The identifier status is set to RESERVED.
        With DataCite, this is done by sending a POST request with the XML metadata (as the request body) to https://mds.xsd.datacite.org/metadata. The DOI is specified inside the metadata.
        With EZID, this is done by sending a PUT request to http://ezid.cdlib.org/id/{id} where {id} is a unique id with shoulder/namespace prefix, and by setting the "_status" metadata element to "reserved".
        Specified by:
        reserve in interface DoiService
        Parameters:
        doi - the identifier to reserve
        metadata - the metadata to be associated with the doi. The identifier inside the metadata will be overwritten by the doi parameter given
        Throws:
        DoiException - if the operation failed for any reason

      • reserveRandom

        public org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI reserveRandom(String prefix,
                                          int length,
                                          DataCiteMetadata metadata)
                                            throws DoiException
        Description copied from interface: DoiService
        Mints a new random identifier with the given DOI prefix and reserves it.
        Specified by:
        reserveRandom in interface DoiService
        Parameters:
        prefix - the identifier prefix to use to generate the random DOI
        length - the length of the randomly generated suffix string. minimum 3, 5-10 is recommended.
        metadata - the metadata to be associated with the doi. The identifier inside the metadata will be overwritten by the generated DOI
        Throws:
        DoiException - if the operation failed for any reason

      • register

        public void register(org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI doi,
            URI target)
              throws DoiException
        Description copied from interface: DoiService
        Registers an identifier that has been reserved and assigns it a URL for resolution. This causes the DOI to be publicly registered with resolvers and other external services. DataCite and EZID restrict target URL domains and the target URL given MUST have a domain matching your account permissions.
        Specified by:
        register in interface DoiService
        Parameters:
        doi - the identifier to register
        target - the URL the DOI should resolve to
        Throws:
        DoiException - if the operation failed for any reason

      • delete

        public boolean delete(org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI doi)
               throws DoiException
        Description copied from interface: DoiService
        Tries to delete an identifier. If the DOI has only been reserved it will be fully deleted, if it was registered before it's status will become unavailable. You can register an unavailable DOI again if needed.
        With DataCite, this is done by sending a DELETE request to https://mds.xsd.datacite.org/metadata, which inactivates the DOI.
        With EZID, this is done by sending a DELETE request to http://ezid.cdlib.org/id/{id} or by setting the "_status" metadata element to "unavailable" for registered DOIs.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface DoiService
        Parameters:
        doi - the identifier to delete
        Returns:
        true if the DOI was fully deleted, false if it became unavailable
        Throws:
        DoiException - if the operation failed for any reason

      • update

        public void update(org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI doi,
          DataCiteMetadata metadata)
            throws DoiException
        Description copied from interface: DoiService
        Updates the identifier metadata. This method must be called every time the object or metadata referenced by the identifier changes (e.g. a gets republished, a data set is replaced by a new major version, etc).
        With DataCite, this is done by sending a POST request with XML metadata (as the request body) to https://mds.xsd.datacite.org/metadata.
        With EZID, this is done by sending a POST request with metadata (as request body) to http://ezid.cdlib.org/id/{id}.
        Specified by:
        update in interface DoiService
        Parameters:
        doi - the identifier of metadata to update
        Throws:
        DoiException - if the operation failed for any reason

      • update

        public void update(org.gbif.api.model.common.DOI doi,
          URI target)
            throws DoiException
        Description copied from interface: DoiService
        Updates the registered identifiers target URL. DataCite and EZID restrict target URL domains and the target URL given MUST have a domain matching your account permissions.
        Specified by:
        update in interface DoiService
        Parameters:
        doi - the identifier of metadata to update
        target - the new URL the DOI should resolve to
        Throws:
        DoiException - if the operation failed for any reason
